Home → News → Easter Eggstreme Reading Challenge at Wickham Market Library

Easter Eggstreme Reading Challenge at Wickham Market Library

Wickham Market Library are holding their Easter Eggstreme Reading Challenge again this year.

The reading challenge is open to any children aged under 12. The children have to collect a reading record card from the library and the aim is to read four books during the Easter period. Once they have completed all four books they are entered into a prize draw. There are lots of prizes and everyone turning up to the presentation on Sunday 10 April at 3pm will get given a small Lindt chocolate egg.

The reading record cards are available now. This is the third year Wickham Market Library has run the challenge and last year 50 children took part.
